result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: dismissed as a read in to case:  15CM2295

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John A Eberhardy in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner. 
Court to Address - NGI Evaluation.

Both State and Defense have a copy of Dr. Collins Evaluation.
Dr. Collins evaluation supports an NGI Plea.
Both State and Defense are not requesting a second evaluation or contesting Dr. Collins Evaluation.

State moves to dismiss this matter as a read in to case:  15CM2295

Order for Examination Under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 12/22/15.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John A Eberhardy in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  

Atty. Weitzner requests the court order an NGI Examination under 971.16 and presented arguments.
Court Grants and Orders an NGI Examination under 971.16 on an out patient basis.
Court appoints Dr. Collins.
Examination to be filed by:  01/29/16.
  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
